message: I've been trying various single malts over the last year or so, and so far the Glenlivet 15 year has been my favorite.  What are other peoples favorites?
I don't know if it's my favorite, but I've been into the Compass Double Single lately. Have a bottle of Glenmorangie Finealta on the way that I'm excited about too.
Lagavulin, Laphroaig, Balvenie... heavy peaty things.
balvenie isn't that peaty, stop lying @mtrichardson
@tougas: assuming you mean the 15 year french cask? if so, seek out the 21 balvenia portwood

@mtrichardson Yeah, I'm also really into peaty islay style drams.  I got a bottle of some cask strength Laphroig for Christmas last year and went through it a lot faster than I expected.  Great stuff.
Laphroaig is a favorite. Some of the Bowmore's are quite tasty and relatively inexpensive (12 and 15 year old in particular).
Ardbeg Corryvreckan is my fav winter dram.
@jacob I'm not a huge fan of the Balvenie. I got an 18 from the mother-in-law for xmas and, although I appreciate it, it really isn't for me.
Agree with @Gary_Owhere, most of Bowmore's offerings are quite good and are easy on the wallet. The 12-year is one of my most frequent purchases.
Bottles from Islay usually find their way into my cabinet.
15 y/o bowore is super super tasty
My favorite is Ardbeg Supernova, good stuff and it has some 'calories' too :)
